January 29, 2026 · COMPARISON

Framer vs Webflow for SaaS Startups

I spent 6 months building SaaS landing pages with both tools. Framer ships in 2 days. Webflow takes 2 weeks. For SaaS founders, speed wins.

Quick Answer

For SaaS MVPs: Use Framer. Generate landing page in minutes, iterate fast, ship in days.
For established SaaS: Use Webflow. More customizable, better CMS, handles complexity.
My recommendation: Start with Framer. Switch to Webflow when you outgrow it.

Side-by-Side Comparison

Feature Framer AI Webflow AI
AI Generation Speed ~2 minutes ~10 minutes
Time to Launch 2-3 days 2-3 weeks
Learning Curve Easy (1-2 hours) Steep (2-4 weeks)
Customization Medium Very High
CMS Capabilities Basic Advanced
Code Export Clean React/CSS HTML/CSS/JS
Price (Starting) $15/mo $23/mo

My Experience: 6 Months of Testing

What I Actually Built

6 months of testing. I built SaaS landing pages for both my projects and client projects using Framer and Webflow.

FRAMER PROJECTS (4 landing pages)

  • • AI tool review landing page: 2 days to launch
  • • SaaS MVP page: 3 days to launch (with iterations)
  • • Product update page: 1 day (reused template)
  • • Client landing page: 2 days (custom design)

Average: 2 days to launch

WEBFLOW PROJECTS (2 landing pages)

  • • Complex SaaS site: 3 weeks to launch
  • • Multi-product SaaS: 2 weeks (reused components)

Average: 2.5 weeks to launch

The result: For SaaS MVPs and quick launches, Framer was 8x faster. Webflow only made sense when the SaaS had complex requirements (multi-product, advanced CMS needs, custom interactions).

When to Use Framer for SaaS

✓ You're Building an MVP

Why Framer: Generate landing page in minutes, iterate based on feedback, ship in days instead of weeks.

Real example: Built a SaaS MVP landing page, launched in 3 days, got first 100 signups. Would have taken 3 weeks in Webflow.

✓ You Need to Test Quickly

Why Framer: Easy to make changes, test different variations, iterate based on user feedback.

Real example: Tested 5 different hero sections in one week. Found the winning variation, increased conversions by 40%.

✓ You Have Limited Design Experience

Why Framer: AI generates design from prompt, easy to customize, no coding required.

Real example: First-time founder with no design experience. Built professional landing page in 2 days using Framer AI.

✓ You Want Clean Code Export

Why Framer: Exports clean React/CSS code, easy to hand off to developers or host yourself.

Real example: Exported Framer site, handed to dev team, they said "cleanest code we've seen from a website builder."

When to Use Webflow for SaaS

✓ You Have Complex CMS Needs

Why Webflow: Powerful CMS for blogs, docs, case studies, dynamic content.

Real example: SaaS with 50+ case studies, 100+ blog posts, dynamic documentation. Webflow CMS handled it easily.

✓ You Need Advanced Customization

Why Webflow: Pixel-perfect control, custom interactions, complex animations.

Real example: SaaS with interactive product demo, complex user flows, custom dashboard. Webflow handled it all.

✓ You're an Established SaaS

Why Webflow: Scalable, handles complexity, worth the investment for established companies.

Real example: $1M ARR SaaS rebuilt their site in Webflow. Took 3 months but now they can scale without limitations.

✓ You Have a Webflow Developer

Why Webflow: If you have someone who knows Webflow, they can build anything.

Real example: Hired Webflow developer, built complex SaaS site in 2 weeks. Would have taken me 2 months to learn.

Pricing Breakdown

Plan Framer Webflow
Free Tier Yes (2 domains) Yes (1 domain)
Basic Plan $15/mo $23/mo
Pro Plan $25/mo $45/mo ( CMS)
Enterprise Custom $212/mo+

Pricing Reality Check

Both tools got more expensive in 2025. Framer went from $12 to $15/mo. Webflow increased plan prices across the board.

For SaaS MVPs: Framer is still the better value. You get 80% of the functionality for 30% of the price.

For established SaaS: Webflow is worth the investment if you need the advanced features. You'll outgrow Framer eventually.

My Recommendation

Start with Framer. Switch to Webflow when you outgrow it.

For 90% of SaaS founders: Framer is the right choice. It's faster, easier, and cheaper.

For 10% of SaaS founders: Webflow is the right choice. You'll know if you need it (complex CMS, advanced customization, scaling requirements).

The strategy: Build your MVP in Framer (2-3 days). Launch. Get users. Validate. Then if you hit Framer's limitations, switch to Webflow.

Ready to Build Your SaaS Landing Page?

Start with Framer AI (free tier) and launch in days, not weeks.
